title: Drawing, "Two Drawings of the Madonna and Child in Ovals, Studies after Giambologna and Alfonzo da Ferrero; Herm and Chimera, after Antique", 1821–22
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash, over black chalk on white heavy wove paper
inscribed: in pen and brown ink within oval at upper left: MATER AMABILIS; below it atleft: Roma/ Gian Bologna; within oval at upper right: MATER CREATORIS; below it at right: Bologna/ Alfonzo da Ferrero; at lower left: 10 monumentiantichi Roma
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description: Above, two oval compositions, both with half figures of the Madonna with Child. Below, at lower left, herm or stele, with oak leaves at base, winged putto sits atop pillow or turban which rests on head of bearded man. At lower right, seated chimera in profile, with goat's head, lion's paws, and wings.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Two Drawings of the Madonna and Child in Ovals, Studies after Giambologna and Alfonzo da Ferrero; Herm and Chimera, after Antique", 1821–22.
1821–22. Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash, over black chalk on white heavy wove paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors. 1901-39-3557-1.
